column4: anyone experienced their w/nic's prompting for wireless password again and again without connecting?
why not just install xfce4-desktop or what eve rthe metapackage is called and tell lightdm to use that session
are you 10000000% sure the password is right?
yep 100% positive, this is really giving me greif
ok, then do what Coburn said :)
if you have control over the ap, try removing the security temporarily to see if it connects at all
good ideas, yep fn f2 will diable/enable thanks
well guys, with security disabled it connects
I guess enable and try again?
also the wireless filter was still set on allowed mac addresses so that is now disabled, that may help
Erin  I have an old ibook that doesnt like wpa or even wep
wpa2 with AES is about the best you can do nowadays
